meanings.definition: A person who assesses the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: The valuator carefully examined the antique vase to determine its value.
meanings.sent2: The valuator at the pawn shop appraised the jewelry brought in by customers.
meanings.sent3: The valuator at the charity event mistakenly priced a toy car as if it were a real one.
meanings.sent4: She was a valuator of emotions, always able to gauge how others were feeling.
meanings.sent5: The valuator's job is to assign a monetary worth to various items based on their condition and rarity.

meanings.definition: To determine the value or worth of something.
meanings.sent1: He will valuate the house before deciding on a selling price.
meanings.sent2: The insurance company will valuate the damage caused by the storm.
meanings.sent3: She valuated her collection of stamps and was pleasantly surprised by their worth.
meanings.sent4: The teacher valuated the students' projects based on creativity and effort.
meanings.sent5: It is important to valuate your skills and experiences when applying for a job.
